alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 3:33PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Weld, southeastern Larimer and northeastern Boulder Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 330 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Timnath to near Cedar Cove, or along a line extending from 5 miles south of Fort Collins to 49 miles north of Denver. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph, hail up to nickel, locally heavy rainfall and minor street flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... South Fort Collins, Loveland, Windsor, Johnstown, Berthoud, Mead, Lyons, Timnath, Carter Lake, and Masonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County
